title: Check for a Balanced Equation
text: Check if the equation is balanced or not. If not, balance the equation.

title: Calculate the Molar Amount of $$Fe_2 O_3$$
text: Use the equation $$\text{Moles of Reactant A} = (\text{Mass of Reactant A}) \times \frac{\text{Moles of Reactant A}}{\text{Molar Mass of Reactant A}}$$.

title: Calculate the Molar Amount of $$Fe_2 O_3$$
text: What is $$25.13 \text{ g } Fe_2O_3 \times \frac{1 \text{ mol } Fe_2O_3}{159.7 \text{ g } Fe_2O_3}$$? Keep three decimal places.

title: Identify the Stoichiometric Factor
text: The stoichiometric factor relating the two substances of interest is $$\frac{3 \text{ mol CO}}{1 \text{ mol } Fe_2O_3}$$.

title: Calculate the Molar Amount of CO
text: The molar amount of CO is derived by multiplying the provided molar amount of $$Fe_2 O_3$$ by multiplying the stoichiometric factor.

title: Calculate the Molar Amount of CO
text: What is $$0.157 \text{ mol } Fe_2O_3 \times \frac{3 \text{ mol CO}}{1 \text{ mol } Fe_2O_3}$$? Keep three decimal places.

title: Calculate the Mass of CO
text: Calculate the Mass of CO with $$\text{Mass of Reactant A} = \left(\frac{\text{Molar Mass of Reactant A}}{\text{Moles of Reactant A}}\right)\times{\text{Moles of Reactant A}}$$.

title: Calculate the Mass of CO
text: What is $$(0.471 \text{ mol CO}) \times \frac{28.01 \text{ g CO}}{1 \text{mol CO}}$$? Give your answer as an integer.
